attributes.action: stop the 'supersizing' of Wimbledon Chase Primary School and order Merton LEA to reinvest an £18 million windfall to build new schools in the borough
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Over the last 10 years, Merton Local Education Authority has sold off schools and playing fields, raising £18 million.

The local authorities now find themselves substantially short of primary school places and wish to proceed with a low-cost remedy, intending to ‘supersize’ Wimbledon Chase Primary School, as well as expand a number of other good schools in the area, regardless of the consequences to long-term educational standards.

Wimbledon Chase would become an intimidating institution with more than 700 children, too large a school for young children (some of whom are only 3 or 4 years old), detrimental for their education, their wellbeing and, with the planned loss of playing fields, their health.

Increased traffic would create a local black spot and gridlock on a daily basis in the surrounding conservation area.

There has been no effective consultation by Merton LEA to the proposed expansion, with local residents not informed of the plans, and the objections of concerned parents simply ignored.

Merton LEA’s current plans ignore the interests of children and local residents and lack strategic direction.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "stop the 'supersizing' of Wimbledon Chase Primary School and order Merton LEA to reinvest an £18 million windfall to build new schools in the borough."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page18590
